DOC.brief_title: Telephone-Based Care Management Program Individuals With Anxiety Disorders
DOC.detailed_description: Numerous study show telephone-based collaborative care program may effective way monitor quality life individual mental health issue anxiety disorder . With regular monitor telephone conversation , health care provider gain information patient convenient forum . This study determine whether telephone-based care management program improve anxiety symptom , alcohol abuse , employment pattern , use health care service , health-related quality life individual panic disorder generalize anxiety disorder ( GAD ) . Participants randomly assign receive either usual care telephone-based collaborative care program 12 month . Usual care may include one several different treatment pharmacotherapy cognitive behavioral therapy ; treatment choose participant ' physician . Participants assign telephone-based program choice type treatment receive ; choice include pharmacotherapy , workbook training design help participant improve cop skill , referral community mental health specialist , combination treatment . Participants receive usual care continue treatment 12 month . After 12 month , participant undergo interview complete self-report scale assessment anxiety symptom , health care use , alcohol use , quality life . Their participation trial end 12 month . Participants telephone intervention group receive telephone call 1 2 time every month 12 month . During call , participant ask attitude toward adherence treatment regimen . They also ask recent episode anxiety experience cop technique use . Monthly follow-up call continue additional 12 month first year study ; help determine long-term effectiveness telephone-based intervention .
